title: Dhyana Yoga
subtitle: The Yoga of Meditation
summary: In this chapter, Krishna explains the practice of meditation (dhyana) as the path to self-realization. He describes the ideal conditions for meditation, the posture to be maintained, and how to control the mind. The chapter also discusses the fate of unsuccessful yogis and concludes by declaring that the yogi is superior to ascetics, scholars, and ritualists.

verses.sanskrit: श्रीभगवानुवाच | अनाश्रितः कर्मफलं कार्यं कर्म करोति यः | स संन्यासी च योगी च न निरग्निर्न चाक्रियः ||
verses.transliteration: śrī bhagavān uvāca | anāśritaḥ karma-phalaṃ kāryaṃ karma karoti yaḥ | sa sannyāsī ca yogī ca na niragnir na cākriyaḥ ||
verses.translation: The Blessed Lord said: One who performs his duty without depending on the fruits of action is a true renunciant and yogi, not one who merely avoids fire (rituals) or action.
verses.explanation: Krishna redefines renunciation - true sannyasa is detachment from results while performing duties, not mere abandonment of rituals or work.

verses.sanskrit: यं संन्यासमिति प्राहुर्योगं तं विद्धि पाण्डव | न ह्यसंन्यस्तसङ्कल्पो योगी भवति कश्चन ||
verses.transliteration: yaṃ sannyāsam iti prāhur yogaṃ taṃ viddhi pāṇḍava | na hy asannyasta-saṅkalpo yogī bhavati kaścana ||
verses.translation: What they call renunciation (sannyasa), know that to be yoga, O Pandava. For none becomes a yogi without renouncing selfish desires.
verses.explanation: Yoga and true renunciation are identical - both require abandoning selfish motives, not just external actions.

verses.sanskrit: आरुरुक्षोर्मुनेर्योगं कर्म कारणमुच्यते | योगारूढस्य तस्यैव शमः कारणमुच्यते ||
verses.transliteration: ārurukṣor muner yogaṃ karma kāraṇam ucyate | yogārūḍhasya tasyaiva śamaḥ kāraṇam ucyate ||
verses.translation: For the sage who seeks to ascend to yoga, action is said to be the means. For that same sage who has attained yoga, tranquility is said to be the means.
verses.explanation: Action (karma yoga) is the path for beginners; tranquility (meditation) becomes the means after advancement.

verses.sanskrit: यदा हि नेन्द्रियार्थेषु न कर्मस्वनुषज्जते | सर्वसङ्कल्पसंन्यासी योगारूढस्तदोच्यते ||
verses.transliteration: yadā hi nendriyārtheṣu na karmasv anuṣajjate | sarva-saṅkalpa-sannyāsī yogārūḍhas tadocyate ||
verses.translation: When one is not attached to sense objects or actions, having renounced all desires, then one is said to have ascended to yoga.
verses.explanation: The state of accomplished yoga is marked by complete detachment from sensory pleasures and ego-driven actions.

verses.sanskrit: उद्धरेदात्मनात्मानं नात्मानमवसादयेत् | आत्मैव ह्यात्मनो बन्धुरात्मैव रिपुरात्मनः ||
verses.transliteration: uddhared ātmanātmānaṃ nātmānam avasādayet | ātmaiva hy ātmano bandhur ātmaiva ripur ātmanaḥ ||
verses.translation: Let one lift oneself by oneself; let one not degrade oneself. For the self alone is the friend of the self, and the self alone is the enemy of the self.
verses.explanation: The mind can be both friend and foe - through proper discipline, one elevates rather than degrades oneself.

verses.sanskrit: बन्धुरात्मात्मनस्तस्य येनात्मैवात्मना जितः | अनात्मनस्तु शत्रुत्वे वर्तेतात्मैव शत्रुवत् ||
verses.transliteration: bandhur ātmātmanas tasya yenātmaivātmanā jitaḥ | anātmanas tu śatrutve vartetātmaiva śatru-vat ||
verses.translation: For one who has conquered the mind, the self is a friend. But for one who has failed, the self remains hostile, like an enemy.
verses.explanation: Self-mastery makes the mind an ally; lack of control makes it a constant adversary.

verses.sanskrit: जितात्मनः प्रशान्तस्य परमात्मा समाहितः | शीतोष्णसुखदुःखेषु तथा मानापमानयोः ||
verses.transliteration: jitātmanaḥ praśāntasya paramātmā samāhitaḥ | śītoṣṇa-sukha-duḥkheṣu tathā mānāpamānayoḥ ||
verses.translation: For the self-controlled and peaceful, the Supreme Self remains equipoised in cold and heat, pleasure and pain, as well as honor and dishonor.
verses.explanation: The perfected yogi maintains steady awareness of the Divine regardless of external circumstances.

verses.sanskrit: ज्ञानविज्ञानतृप्तात्मा कूटस्थो विजितेन्द्रियः | युक्त इत्युच्यते योगी समलोष्टाश्मकाञ्चनः ||
verses.transliteration: jñāna-vijñāna-tṛptātmā kūṭastho vijitendriyaḥ | yukta ity ucyate yogī sama-loṣṭāśma-kāñcanaḥ ||
verses.translation: The yogi whose self is content with knowledge and wisdom, who remains unshaken, who has conquered the senses, is called united (with Spirit). To such a one, a clod, a stone, and gold are alike.
verses.explanation: The true yogi, satisfied with higher wisdom, sees no essential difference between ordinary and precious objects.

verses.sanskrit: सुहृन्मित्रार्युदासीनमध्यस्थद्वेष्यबन्धुषु | साधुष्वपि च पापेषु समबुद्धिर्विशिष्यते ||
verses.transliteration: suhṛn-mitrāry-udāsīna-madhyastha-dveṣya-bandhuṣu | sādhuṣv api ca pāpeṣu sama-buddhir viśiṣyate ||
verses.translation: One who is equal-minded toward friends, companions, enemies, neutrals, arbiters, haters, relatives, saints, and sinners - excels.
verses.explanation: The highest spiritual achievement is maintaining equanimity toward all beings, regardless of relationship.

verses.sanskrit: योगी युञ्जीत सततमात्मानं रहसि स्थितः | एकाकी यतचित्तात्मा निराशीरपरिग्रहः ||
verses.transliteration: yogī yuñjīta satatam ātmānaṃ rahasi sthitaḥ | ekākī yata-cittātmā nirāśīr aparigrahaḥ ||
verses.translation: The yogi should constantly practice meditation, remaining alone in solitude, self-controlled, free from desires and possessions.
verses.explanation: Krishna prescribes the ideal conditions for meditation: solitude, mental discipline, and non-attachment.

verses.sanskrit: शुचौ देशे प्रतिष्ठाप्य स्थिरमासनमात्मनः | नात्युच्छ्रितं नातिनीचं चैलाजिनकुशोत्तरम् || तत्रैकाग्रं मनः कृत्वा यतचित्तेन्द्रियक्रियः | उपविश्यासने युञ्ज्याद्योगमात्मविशुद्धये ||
verses.transliteration: śucau deśe pratiṣṭhāpya sthiram āsanam ātmanaḥ | nāty-ucchritaṃ nāti-nīcaṃ cailājina-kuśottaram || tatraikāgraṃ manaḥ kṛtvā yata-cittendriya-kriyaḥ | upaviśyāsane yuñjyād yogam ātma-viśuddhaye ||
verses.translation: In a clean place, having established a firm seat - neither too high nor too low, covered with cloth, deer skin, and kusha grass - there, focusing the mind on one point, controlling the activities of the mind and senses, one should practice yoga for self-purification.
verses.explanation: Detailed instructions for meditation posture and environment: a clean, quiet place with a simple seat, focusing on single-pointed concentration.

verses.sanskrit: समं कायशिरोग्रीवं धारयन्नचलं स्थिरः | सम्प्रेक्ष्य नासिकाग्रं स्वं दिशश्चानवलोकयन् ||
verses.transliteration: samaṃ kāya-śiro-grīvaṃ dhārayann acalaṃ sthiraḥ | samprekṣya nāsikāgraṃ svaṃ diśaś cānavalokayan ||
verses.translation: Holding the body, head, and neck straight and motionless, keeping the gaze fixed on the tip of the nose, without looking around.
verses.explanation: Physical posture for meditation: spinal alignment with steady gaze to minimize external distractions.

verses.sanskrit: प्रशान्तात्मा विगतभीर्ब्रह्मचारिव्रते स्थितः | मनः संयम्य मच्चित्तो युक्त आसीत मत्परः ||
verses.transliteration: praśāntātmā vigata-bhīr brahmacāri-vrate sthitaḥ | manaḥ saṃyamya mac-citto yukta āsīta mat-paraḥ ||
verses.translation: Serene-minded, fearless, firm in the vow of celibacy, controlling the mind, with thoughts fixed on Me, the yogi should sit absorbed in Me.
verses.explanation: The mental attitude for meditation: peaceful, fearless, disciplined, with consciousness absorbed in the Divine.

verses.sanskrit: युञ्जन्नेवं सदात्मानं योगी नियतमानसः | शान्तिं निर्वाणपरमां मत्संस्थामधिगच्छति ||
verses.transliteration: yuñjann evaṃ sadātmānaṃ yogī niyata-mānasaḥ | śāntiṃ nirvāṇa-paramāṃ mat-saṃsthām adhigacchati ||
verses.translation: Thus, constantly practicing, the yogi of controlled mind attains the peace culminating in nirvana that abides in Me.
verses.explanation: Through regular practice, the yogi achieves supreme peace and union with the Divine.

verses.sanskrit: नात्यश्नतस्तु योगोऽस्ति न चैकान्तमनश्नतः | न चातिस्वप्नशीलस्य जाग्रतो नैव चार्जुन ||
verses.transliteration: nātyaśnatas tu yogo 'sti na caikāntam anaśnataḥ | na cāti-svapna-śīlasya jāgrato naiva cārjuna ||
verses.translation: Verily, yoga is not for one who eats too much or too little, nor for one who sleeps too much or too little, O Arjuna.
verses.explanation: Moderation in eating and sleeping is essential for successful yoga practice.

verses.sanskrit: युक्ताहारविहारस्य युक्तचेष्टस्य कर्मसु | युक्तस्वप्नावबोधस्य योगो भवति दुःखहा ||
verses.transliteration: yuktāhāra-vihārasya yukta-ceṣṭasya karmasu | yukta-svapnāvabodhasya yogo bhavati duḥkha-hā ||
verses.translation: For one who is regulated in eating, recreation, activity, sleep, and wakefulness, yoga destroys all misery.
verses.explanation: Balanced lifestyle supports yoga practice, which in turn alleviates all suffering.

verses.sanskrit: यदा विनियतं चित्तमात्मन्येवावतिष्ठते | निःस्पृहः सर्वकामेभ्यो युक्त इत्युच्यते तदा ||
verses.transliteration: yadā viniyataṃ cittam ātmany evāvatiṣṭhate | niḥspṛhaḥ sarva-kāmebhyo yukta ity ucyate tadā ||
verses.translation: When the perfectly disciplined mind becomes free from all desires and rests content in the Self alone, then one is said to be united in yoga.
verses.explanation: The culmination of yoga is when the mind, free from desires, remains fixed in pure awareness.

verses.sanskrit: यथा दीपो निवातस्थो नेङ्गते सोपमा स्मृता | योगिनो यतचित्तस्य युञ्जतो योगमात्मनः ||
verses.transliteration: yathā dīpo nivāta-stho neṅgate sopamā smṛtā | yogino yata-cittasya yuñjato yogam ātmanaḥ ||
verses.translation: As a lamp in a windless place does not flicker - such is the simile used for the yogi whose mind is controlled and who practices yoga of the self.
verses.explanation: The steady mind of a yogi is compared to a flame undisturbed by wind - unwavering in concentration.

verses.sanskrit: यत्रोपरमते चित्तं निरुद्धं योगसेवया | यत्र चैवात्मनात्मानं पश्यन्नात्मनि तुष्यति || सुखमात्यन्तिकं यत्तद्बुद्धिग्राह्यमतीन्द्रियम् | वेत्ति यत्र न चैवायं स्थितश्चलति तत्त्वतः || यं लब्ध्वा चापरं लाभं मन्यते नाधिकं ततः | यस्मिन्स्थितो न दुःखेन गुरुणापि विचाल्यते || तं विद्याद्दुःखसंयोगवियोगं योगसंज्ञितम् | स निश्चयेन योक्तव्यो योगोऽनिर्विण्णचेतसा ||
verses.transliteration: yatroparamate cittaṃ niruddhaṃ yoga-sevayā | yatra caivātmanātmānaṃ paśyann ātmani tuṣyati || sukham ātyantikaṃ yat tad buddhi-grāhyam atīndriyam | vetti yatra na caivāyaṃ sthitaś calati tattvataḥ || yaṃ labdhvā cāparaṃ lābhaṃ manyate nādhikaṃ tataḥ | yasmin sthito na duḥkhena guruṇāpi vicālyate || taṃ vidyād duḥkha-saṃyoga-viyogaṃ yoga-saṃjñitam | sa niścayena yoktavyo yogo 'nirviṇṇa-cetasā ||
verses.translation: When the mind, restrained by yoga practice, becomes still, and when seeing the Self by the self, one is satisfied in the Self... Where one experiences that infinite joy beyond the senses, which the intellect can grasp, and established wherein one never departs from truth... Having obtained which, one thinks no other gain superior to it, and wherein established, one is not shaken even by heavy sorrow... That state of severance from union with pain should be known as yoga, which is to be attained with resolute determination.
verses.explanation: The profound state of yoga brings supreme joy beyond sensory experience, where one becomes immune to worldly sorrows through firm realization of the Self.

verses.sanskrit: संकल्पप्रभवान्कामांस्त्यक्त्वा सर्वानशेषतः | मनसैवेन्द्रियग्रामं विनियम्य समन्ततः ||
verses.transliteration: saṅkalpa-prabhavān kāmāns tyaktvā sarvān aśeṣataḥ | manasaivendriya-grāmaṃ viniyamya samantataḥ ||
verses.translation: Completely abandoning all desires arising from thoughts, restraining the senses from all sides with the mind.
verses.explanation: The yogi withdraws attention from all desires and controls the senses through mental discipline.

verses.sanskrit: शनैः शनैरुपरमेद्बुद्ध्या धृतिगृहीतया | आत्मसंस्थं मनः कृत्वा न किञ्चिदपि चिन्तयेत् ||
verses.transliteration: śanaiḥ śanair uparamed buddhyā dhṛti-gṛhītayā | ātma-saṃsthaṃ manaḥ kṛtvā na kiñcid api cintayet ||
verses.translation: Gradually, step by step, with full conviction, one should become situated in trance by means of intelligence, and thus the mind should be fixed on the Self alone and should think of nothing else.
verses.explanation: Meditation should be developed gradually with patience and intelligence until the mind becomes completely absorbed.

verses.sanskrit: यतो यतो निश्चरति मनश्चञ्चलमस्थिरम् | ततस्ततो नियम्यैतदात्मन्येव वशं नयेत् ||
verses.transliteration: yato yato niścarati manaś cañcalam asthiram | tatas tato niyamyaitad ātmany eva vaśaṃ nayet ||
verses.translation: From whatever and wherever the restless, unsteady mind wanders, one should withdraw it and bring it back under the control of the Self.
verses.explanation: The key to meditation is repeatedly bringing back the wandering mind to focus.

verses.sanskrit: प्रशान्तमनसं ह्येनं योगिनं सुखमुत्तमम् | उपैति शान्तरजसं ब्रह्मभूतमकल्मषम् ||
verses.transliteration: praśānta-manasaṃ hy enaṃ yoginaṃ sukham uttamam | upaiti śānta-rajasaṃ brahma-bhūtam akalmaṣam ||
verses.translation: Supreme bliss comes to the yogi whose mind is peaceful, whose passions are subdued, who is free from sin, and who has become one with Brahman.
verses.explanation: The perfected yogi experiences supreme happiness through mental tranquility and divine union.

verses.sanskrit: युञ्जन्नेवं सदात्मानं योगी विगतकल्मषः | सुखेन ब्रह्मसंस्पर्शमत्यन्तं सुखमश्नुते ||
verses.transliteration: yuñjann evaṃ sadātmānaṃ yogī vigata-kalmaṣaḥ | sukhena brahma-saṃsparśam atyantaṃ sukham aśnute ||
verses.translation: Thus, constantly engaging the mind in yoga practice, freed from sins, the yogi easily attains the infinite bliss of contact with Brahman.
verses.explanation: Regular practice purifies the yogi, enabling direct experience of divine bliss.

verses.sanskrit: सर्वभूतस्थमात्मानं सर्वभूतानि चात्मनि | ईक्षते योगयुक्तात्मा सर्वत्र समदर्शनः ||
verses.transliteration: sarva-bhūta-stham ātmānaṃ sarva-bhūtāni cātmani | īkṣate yoga-yuktātmā sarvatra sama-darśanaḥ ||
verses.translation: With mind united in yoga, one sees the Self abiding in all beings and all beings in the Self - one sees the same everywhere.
verses.explanation: The yogi perceives the unity of existence - the same divine essence in all creatures.

verses.sanskrit: यो मां पश्यति सर्वत्र सर्वं च मयि पश्यति | तस्याहं न प्रणश्यामि स च मे न प्रणश्यति ||
verses.transliteration: yo māṃ paśyati sarvatra sarvaṃ ca mayi paśyati | tasyāhaṃ na praṇaśyāmi sa ca me na praṇaśyati ||
verses.translation: One who sees Me everywhere and sees everything in Me - I am never lost to him, nor is he ever lost to Me.
verses.explanation: The vision of divine omnipresence establishes an eternal bond between the yogi and Krishna.

verses.sanskrit: सर्वभूतस्थितं यो मां भजत्येकत्वमास्थितः | सर्वथा वर्तमानोऽपि स योगी मयि वर्तते ||
verses.transliteration: sarva-bhūta-sthitaṃ yo māṃ bhajaty ekatvam āsthitaḥ | sarvathā vartamāno 'pi sa yogī mayi vartate ||
verses.translation: That yogi who, established in oneness, worships Me dwelling in all beings - he abides in Me, whatever his mode of life.
verses.explanation: Seeing Krishna in all beings, the yogi remains united with the Divine regardless of external circumstances.

verses.sanskrit: आत्मौपम्येन सर्वत्र समं पश्यति योऽर्जुन | सुखं वा यदि वा दुःखं स योगी परमो मतः ||
verses.transliteration: ātmaupamyena sarvatra samaṃ paśyati yo 'rjuna | sukhaṃ vā yadi vā duḥkhaṃ sa yogī paramo mataḥ ||
verses.translation: O Arjuna, that yogi is considered the best who judges happiness or distress in all beings by the same standard as he applies to himself.
verses.explanation: The highest yogi extends equal empathy to all, rejoicing in others' happiness and feeling their distress as his own.

verses.sanskrit: अर्जुन उवाच | योऽयं योगस्त्वया प्रोक्तः साम्येन मधुसूदन | एतस्याहं न पश्यामि चञ्चलत्वात्स्थितिं स्थिराम् ||
verses.transliteration: arjuna uvāca | yo 'yaṃ yogas tvayā proktaḥ sāmyena madhusūdana | etasyāhaṃ na paśyāmi cañcalatvāt sthitiṃ sthirām ||
verses.translation: Arjuna said: O Madhusudana, this yoga of equanimity which You have described - I do not see its steady foundation due to the restlessness of the mind.
verses.explanation: Arjuna expresses his practical difficulty - the mind's inherent instability makes meditation seem unattainable.

verses.sanskrit: चञ्चलं हि मनः कृष्ण प्रमाथि बलवद्दृढम् | तस्याहं निग्रहं मन्ये वायोरिव सुदुष्करम् ||
verses.transliteration: cañcalaṃ hi manaḥ kṛṣṇa pramāthi balavad dṛḍham | tasyāhaṃ nigrahaṃ manye vāyor iva su-duṣkaram ||
verses.translation: For the mind is restless, turbulent, obstinate, and very strong, O Krishna. To control it seems as difficult as controlling the wind.
verses.explanation: Arjuna compares controlling the mind to catching the wind - emphasizing its elusive, powerful nature.

verses.sanskrit: श्रीभगवानुवाच | असंशयं महाबाहो मनो दुर्निग्रहं चलम् | अभ्यासेन तु कौन्तेय वैराग्येण च गृह्यते ||
verses.transliteration: śrī bhagavān uvāca | asaṃśayaṃ mahā-bāho mano durnigrahaṃ calam | abhyāsena tu kaunteya vairāgyeṇa ca gṛhyate ||
verses.translation: The Blessed Lord said: Undoubtedly, O mighty-armed, the mind is difficult to control and restless. But by practice, O Kaunteya, and by detachment, it can be restrained.
verses.explanation: Krishna acknowledges the challenge but assures that consistent practice (abhyasa) and non-attachment (vairagya) can master the mind.

verses.sanskrit: असंयतात्मना योगो दुष्प्राप इति मे मतिः | वश्यात्मना तु यतता शक्योऽवाप्तुमुपायतः ||
verses.transliteration: asaṃyatātmanā yogo duṣprāpa iti me matiḥ | vaśyātmanā tu yatatā śakyo 'vāptum upāyataḥ ||
verses.translation: For one whose mind is uncontrolled, yoga is difficult to attain. But for one who strives with a controlled mind, it is possible through proper means.
verses.explanation: Success in yoga requires sincere effort with disciplined self-regulation.

verses.sanskrit: अर्जुन उवाच | अयतिः श्रद्धयोपेतो योगाच्चलितमानसः | अप्राप्य योगसंसिद्धिं कां गतिं कृष्ण गच्छति ||
verses.transliteration: arjuna uvāca | ayatiḥ śraddhayopeto yogāc calita-mānasaḥ | aprāpya yoga-saṃsiddhiṃ kāṃ gatiṃ kṛṣṇa gacchati ||
verses.translation: Arjuna said: What is the destination of the unsuccessful yogi who begins with faith but whose mind wanders away from yoga and fails to attain perfection, O Krishna?
verses.explanation: Arjuna raises a crucial question about the fate of those who attempt but don't complete the yogic path.

verses.sanskrit: कच्चिन्नोभयविभ्रष्टश्छिन्नाभ्रमिव नश्यति | अप्रतिष्ठो महाबाहो विमूढो ब्रह्मणः पथि ||
verses.transliteration: kaccin nobhaya-vibhraṣṭaś chinnābhram iva naśyati | apratiṣṭho mahā-bāho vimūḍho brahmaṇaḥ pathi ||
verses.translation: Does he not perish like a riven cloud, O mighty-armed, fallen from both (paths), unsupported, deluded on the path to Brahman?
verses.explanation: Arjuna fears the unsuccessful yogi loses both material and spiritual benefits, like a scattered cloud that brings no rain.

verses.sanskrit: एतन्मे संशयं कृष्ण छेत्तुमर्हस्यशेषतः | त्वदन्यः संशयस्यास्य छेत्ता न ह्युपपद्यते ||
verses.transliteration: etan me saṃśayaṃ kṛṣṇa chettum arhasy aśeṣataḥ | tvad anyaḥ saṃśayasyāsya chettā na hy upapadyate ||
verses.translation: This is my doubt, O Krishna. Please dispel it completely. For none other than You can destroy this doubt.
verses.explanation: Arjuna acknowledges Krishna as the supreme authority who alone can resolve this profound question.

verses.sanskrit: श्रीभगवानुवाच | पार्थ नैवेह नामुत्र विनाशस्तस्य विद्यते | न हि कल्याणकृत्कश्चिद्दुर्गतिं तात गच्छति ||
verses.transliteration: śrī bhagavān uvāca | pārtha naiveha nāmutra vināśas tasya vidyate | na hi kalyāṇa-kṛt kaścid durgatiṃ tāta gacchati ||
verses.translation: The Blessed Lord said: O Partha, neither in this world nor the next is there destruction for him. For no doer of good, My son, ever comes to evil.
verses.explanation: Krishna assures that spiritual effort is never lost - the sincere seeker is protected in all realms.

verses.sanskrit: प्राप्य पुण्यकृतां लोकानुषित्वा शाश्वतीः समाः | शुचीनां श्रीमतां गेहे योगभ्रष्टोऽभिजायते ||
verses.transliteration: prāpya puṇya-kṛtāṃ lokān uṣitvā śāśvatīḥ samāḥ | śucīnāṃ śrīmatāṃ gehe yoga-bhraṣṭo 'bhijāyate ||
verses.translation: Having attained the worlds of the righteous and dwelt there for countless years, the fallen yogi is reborn in the house of the pure and prosperous.
verses.explanation: The unsuccessful yogi enjoys heavenly rewards before being reborn in favorable earthly circumstances.

verses.sanskrit: अथवा योगिनामेव कुले भवति धीमताम् | एतद्धि दुर्लभतरं लोके जन्म यदीदृशम् ||
verses.transliteration: athavā yoginām eva kule bhavati dhīmatām | etad dhi durlabhataraṃ loke janma yad īdṛśam ||
verses.translation: Or he is born into a family of wise yogis. Verily, such a birth is most rare in this world.
verses.explanation: Alternatively, the yogi may reincarnate in a spiritually advanced family - a precious opportunity to continue practice.

verses.sanskrit: तत्र तं बुद्धिसंयोगं लभते पौर्वदेहिकम् | यतते च ततो भूयः संसिद्धौ कुरुनन्दन ||
verses.transliteration: tatra taṃ buddhi-saṃyogaṃ labhate paurva-dehikam | yatate ca tato bhūyaḥ saṃsiddhau kuru-nandana ||
verses.translation: There, O Kurunandana, he regains the wisdom acquired in his previous life and strives again for perfection.
verses.explanation: Past spiritual progress is remembered, providing impetus for further advancement.

verses.sanskrit: पूर्वाभ्यासेन तेनैव ह्रियते ह्यवशोऽपि सः | जिज्ञासुरपि योगस्य शब्दब्रह्मातिवर्तते ||
verses.transliteration: pūrvābhyāsena tenaiva hriyate hy avaśo 'pi saḥ | jijñāsur api yogasya śabda-brahmātivartate ||
verses.translation: By that very former practice, he is irresistibly carried onward. Even the seeker of yoga surpasses the rituals of scripture.
verses.explanation: The momentum of past practice propels the yogi beyond conventional religious observances.

verses.sanskrit: प्रयत्नाद्यतमानस्तु योगी संशुद्धकिल्बिषः | अनेकजन्मसंसिद्धस्ततो याति परां गतिम् ||
verses.transliteration: prayatnād yatamānas tu yogī saṃśuddha-kilbiṣaḥ | aneka-janma-saṃsiddhas tato yāti parāṃ gatim ||
verses.translation: But the yogi who strives with diligence, purified of sins, perfected through many births, then attains the supreme goal.
verses.explanation: Persistent effort over lifetimes leads to ultimate perfection and liberation.

verses.sanskrit: तपस्विभ्योऽधिको योगी ज्ञानिभ्योऽपि मतोऽधिकः | कर्मिभ्यश्चाधिको योगी तस्माद्योगी भवार्जुन ||
verses.transliteration: tapasvibhyo 'dhiko yogī jñānibhyo 'pi mato 'dhikaḥ | karmibhyaś cādhiko yogī tasmād yogī bhavārjuna ||
verses.translation: The yogi is superior to ascetics, superior even to the wise, and superior to ritualists. Therefore be a yogi, O Arjuna.
verses.explanation: Krishna declares yoga as the supreme path, surpassing austerity, intellectual knowledge, and ritual worship.

verses.sanskrit: योगिनामपि सर्वेषां मद्गतेनान्तरात्मना | श्रद्धावान्भजते यो मां स मे युक्ततमो मतः ||
verses.transliteration: yoginām api sarveṣāṃ mad-gatenāntarātmanā | śraddhāvān bhajate yo māṃ sa me yukta-tamo mataḥ ||
verses.translation: And of all yogis, the one who worships Me with faith, with his inner self abiding in Me - him I consider most united with Me in yoga.
verses.explanation: The highest yogi is not just the meditator, but the devoted lover of God who merges consciousness with the Divine.
